body_html:
Hi @aaroey,

I pushed the updated script. You should be able to import the module from py3 now. However there is a swig problem that prevents use of the module. TF swig bindings seem somehow inconsistent while passing between py->c++->py layers in py3. It looks like std::strings require byte objects for py3->c++ layer on the other hand strings are converted to unicode string when going back from c++ to py3

I will try to see how it is resolved elsewhere in TF code, but I think as you suggested we can proceed as it is right now.

body:
Hi @aaroey,

I pushed the updated script. You should be able to import the module from py3 now. However there is a swig problem that prevents use of the module. TF swig bindings seem somehow inconsistent while passing between py->c++->py layers in py3. It looks like std::strings require byte objects for py3->c++ layer on the other hand strings are converted to unicode string when going back from c++ to py3

I will try to see how it is resolved elsewhere in TF code, but I think as you suggested we can proceed as it is right now.
